analysis: The statement uses two specific examples (Afghanistan and Iraq) having free elections to argue that free societies will make the world more peaceful. This is a causal claim (free societies → peace) supported by anecdotal evidence. The lever is a faulty causal inference, mistaking correlation (free elections in two countries) for causation (free societies inherently lead to peace). The form is Beta (same predicate: free elections), but the analogy between the examples and the general claim is invalid, violating PTA constraints. This falls under False Cause (3) as it misrepresents a correlation as a direct causal relationship.
